intro: Astragalus alabugensis, commonly known as the Alabugan milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Astragalus alabugensis is also valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
